article:
'Mount Smith' () is a mountain over 1,400 m, standing north of Mawson
Glacier and 7 miles (11 km) north-northwest of Mount Murray in
Victoria Land, Antarctica. Discovered by the Discovery Expedition (1901â04),
which probably named this peak for W. E. Smith, Chief Naval Constructor, who
prepared the plans and supervised construction of the expedition ship RRS
''Discovery''.
